>Sort incoming messages by subject.

Works even better if you first sort by subject. I read the first and last
posts in a thread to see if they're interesting. (The last one in case the
subject has changed but not the subject liine.) I hate digests because you
have to go through the whole thing. And it's harder to save the posts I
want to save from a digest.
Tia

messages.messageBody:
--- Ren <starsuncloud@...> wrote:
>
> " I was thinking of putting this group on daily
> digest. My
> question is what works for you? "
>


Sort incoming messages by subject.

Then you can quickly delete the subjects that you
aren't interested in.



=====
--Susan in VA
WifetoVegman

What is most important and valuable about the home as a base for children's growth into the world is not that it is a better school than the schools, but that it isn't a school at all. John Holt

messages.subject: new....got a ?
messages.msgSnippet: I was thinking of putting this group on daily digest.  My question is what works for you?  Daily digest. You can get a whole bunch of posts in one email,
messages.messageBody:
" I was thinking of putting this group on daily digest. My
question is what works for you? "

Daily digest.
You can get a whole bunch of posts in one email, very easy to scroll through and skim the stuff you aren't interested in, stopping to read the ones that you care about.
It's a big list, but digest makes it manageable for even those that aren't online much....myself included.

Ren in Pensacola
